reviewText: Beautiful color and CinemaScope print. Nota great film by any means, but have always found it very entertaining especially for the exquisite Bernard Herman and Alfred Newman score. Also found Peter Ustinov and Gene Tierney much fun to watch. Biggest draw back is Edmund Purdom in the lead, a very wooden and unemotional actor.
Title: THE EGYPTIAN / dvd

reviewText: This film is one of Hollywoods best for the era in which it was produced. Victor Mature is one of the lead actors and he plays the role gloriously, one cannot but believe in the plight of the lead character, the Egyptian Physician, and glory at the fantastic sets and dialogue. This film is truly a masterpiece, little known to most, but well appreciated by those who have seen it. This film also embodies philosophical and ideological commentary, both embodiments are gracefully represented, and both draw the viewer into deep contemplation. This film will not disappoint, the viewer will be moved.
Title: THE EGYPTIAN / dvd

reviewText: This is an old favorite of mine. Love the sets--typical of old Hollywood grand production days... However, the DVD is subtitled in CHINESE, with no way to turn off the subtitles. Quite annoying! No english menus are available, all Chinese. Very distracting from a great movie! FOX MOVIE CLASSICS, WHERE ARE YOU AND WHY HAVEN'T YOU DONE A DVD ON THIS MOVIE????
summary: Great movie, but beware the subtitles!
Title: THE EGYPTIAN / dvd

reviewText: This is no Charlton Heston epic, but is a fascinating and lavish color production set in ancient Egypt, for we who enjoy such films.
Title: THE EGYPTIAN / dvd

reviewText: Just like "The Robe" and "Demetrius and the Gladiators" any trillogy of the actor Victor Mature must also include a fully restored Anamorphic Widescreen DVD "The Egyptian."This masterpiece of "The Hollywood's 1950Th Cinematography" is desired by all USA buyers. Since this film exist only on some dismally poor import copies selling at the internet, to fill-up the gap created by "Fox Home Video."Beside all that: The movie set designs build-in for "THE EGYPTIAN" included the most complete and acurate reproductions of Egyptian furniture and other items still assemble from the world museum collections. Though I must confess that the screenplay should have been written better for this important époque "The Late XVIII Dynastic Revolutionary Period." A time when very possible Moses was been educated at pharaoh's palace in Amarna Egypt.How come The Hollywood Studios and in particular Time/Warner Inc. (that is doing a re-release of "The Collector's Edition of "Ben-Hur," following Oliver Stone's "Alexander") have up to now failed to release on DVD classic films like this one, is awesome for us to think or ask "WHY NOT????." But we assume that it's probably due only to an oversight created by those in charge of doing so in the film community. Rather than it's been done intentionally by them, there is no doubt about that in our inquiring mind. I HOPE!Because "THE EGYPTIAN" released soon after "Troy/Alexander" and now "The Collector's Edition Ben-Hur" would always be a very marketeable item for sale as a "Classic DVD Release."Please "Fox Home Video" made a DVD soon wothy of this Movie Classic.
summary: WE NEED A DVD RELEASE BY FOX VIDEO OF "THE EGYPTIAN"
Title: THE EGYPTIAN / dvd

reviewText: Oh what a movie (oh what a night)where do I begin with a movie that had so many facts correct regarding this time period in Ancient Khemet. Words can't really describe the magnitude of this film. This is basically the story of Akenaton the Pharoah that believed in the One God. But the physician Sinuway and his plight captures the true moral of the story. How one subdues the carnal passions and one goes about this process is the underlining of this great movie. Every character's fate in this movie is weighed on how they dealt with their passions.Without giving away the plot, I must say this movie more than any other depicts true Freemasonry. You will see Hamites and the tribe of Nimrod if you pay close attention. The working tools of the physician are symbolic of the working tools of the craft (it has been said the medical profession is the only profession thought by Masons to be more esteemed than their own.)For those who believe in the secret brotherhood of Akenaton, and, the passage of this brotherhood even up until today should pay close attention to Akenaton's last speech, as life ebbs through his body, he makes one of the most sublime and deepest speeches I think in movie history!!!Movies and documentaries abound on Freemasonry of late "From Hell" "National Treasure" "League of Extroadinary Gentlemen" "Da Vinci Code" etc. almost giving it a commercial feel. Well put down all the rest and check out this epic classic. I find myself discovering something new everytime I watch this classic flick. I just wish this movie could be reproduced, it seems like alot less worthy movies have been restored and placed on disc why not this one, things that make you go hmmm.... Cecil B put alot of money into this film, and it was well worth it. Victor Mature plays a great heir apparent, he always acts well in movies about ancient times (see him in the biblical movie story "Ruth"). Well I don't think it will be too many modern movies up to the caliber of this 1954 classic.
summary: SIMPLY MAGNIFICENT 10 STARS WOULD BE MORE APPROPRIATE
Title: THE EGYPTIAN / dvd
